questions.question: If I hadn’t dropped out of college I …………………… a better job.
questions.description: In the third conditional we use a past perfect tense in the if-clause and would/could/might have + past participle in the main clause.

questions.question: He took ……………………. his coat.
questions.description: To take off a coat is to remove it.

questions.question: You can do with me what you ……………………
I know you ……………………. lying.
questions.description: Either could be used here. When the main verb is the present tense, the subordinate verb can be in any tense depending upon the context.

questions.question: ……………………. we tried, we could not find a solution to the problem.
questions.description: Fronted adjectives/adverbs are possible in a structure with as or though.

questions.question: The lecture was ………………………..
questions.description: The present participle denotes the people or things that make us feel in a certain way. The past participle denotes how the people or things are feeling.

questions.question: Never ………………………. seen such a mess.
questions.description: Inversion is used when a sentence starts with only or hardly or seldom.

questions.question: Hardly …………………… we arrived when the trouble started.
questions.description: Had is used before the past participle form of the verb.

questions.question: As soon as she received the message, she …………………….. for home.
They ……………………….. many objections.
questions.description: Raise is transitive. Rise is intransitive.

questions.question: If I knew the answer, I ……………………. you.
questions.description: In the second conditional, we use a simple past tense in the if-clause and would + first form of the verb in the main clause.
